channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Entertainment
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2023 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Kirstie Alley, 'Cheers' and 'Veronica's Closet' star, dead at 71
item.description: Actress Kirstie Alley has died after a brief battle with cancer, her children announced on social media.

item.title: John Travolta and Kirstie Alley: A love story
item.description: Kirstie Alley and John Travolta were never romantically involved, but that wasn't how she initially wanted it.

item.title: Chelsea Handler, Leslie Jones and John Leguizamo among guest hosts to step in for Trevor Noah on 'The Daily Show'
item.description: The end of an era is fast approaching at Comedy Central's "The Daily Show," and the network has announced at least the first phase of plans for what's to come next.

item.title: Ashton Kutcher and twin Michael talk health, guilt and rift between them
item.description: In a rare interview, twin brothers Ashton and Michael Kutcher talked about both their bond and their rift.

item.title: Bong Joon Ho's 'Mickey 17' gets trailer and release date
item.description: A first look at "Parasite" director Bong Joon Ho's new movie is here.

item.title: K-pop band Blackpink selected as Time Entertainer of the Year 2022
item.description: Global pop sensation Blackpink have been chosen as Time magazine's 2022 Entertainer of the Year, making the four-woman band the second K-pop artists to earn the title, after BTS in 2020.

item.title: Gabourey Sidibe reveals she's been secretly married for over a year
item.description: It turns out that Gabourey Sidibe has been even busier than previously thought since the beginning of the pandemic.

item.title: 'Harry & Meghan' series gets release date and new trailer
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have an early Christmas gift for their supporters.

item.title: Jill Scott announces 'Who is Jill Scott? Words & Sounds Vol. 1' 23rd anniversary tour
item.description: After a 20th-anniversary tour of Jill Scott's chart-topping album, "Who Is Jill Scott?: Words and Sounds Vol I" was forced to end prematurely due to the pandemic, it will resume.

item.title: Adam Sandler still gets emotional singing sweet Chris Farley song
item.description: Adam Sandler will always Chris Farley.

item.title: Neil Diamond surprises audience with 'Sweet Caroline' performance at Broadway opening of 'A Beautiful Noise'
item.description: Neil Diamond sang "Sweet Caroline" at the Broadway opening of his musical" A Beautiful Noise," five years after retiring due to his Parkinson's diagnosis.

item.title: George Clooney has a simple strategy for being a star in the age of social media
item.description: George Clooney has a surefire way for staying out of trouble as a public figure in the age of social media: stay off of it.

item.title: Ben Affleck says Netflix's 'assembly line' approach to making quality films is 'an impossible job'
item.description: Ben Affleck is sounding off on how movies are being made in today's age of Netflix and other streaming platforms, which offer an ever-expanding glut of content.

item.title: Keke Palmer reveals baby bump as part of her 'Saturday Night Live' opening monologue
item.description: Some people like singing their good news from the rooftops, but in Keke Palmer's case, it was done on live television in front of millions of viewers.

item.title: Christine McVie's music: 5 songs to listen to in her honor
item.description: There's a reason why Christine McVie was considered the heart of Fleetwood Mac.

item.title: Axl Rose will stop tossing mic after a fan was reportedly injured
item.description: Axl Rose is ending a 30-year Guns N' Roses tradition.

item.title: Harrison Ford cracks the whip in teaser trailer for 'Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny'
item.description: It's a name so iconic, he comes with his own theme song, and boy, is it a sweet sound.

item.title: 'Willow' revives the Lucasfilm fantasy with a more contemporary streaming adventure
item.description: Disney's press materials refer to the original 1988 movie "Willow" as "beloved," which despite its admirers feels like nostalgic inflation of a pretty generic George Lucas-plotted fantasy that provided an early directing showcase for Ron Howard. Setting that aside, a Disney+ revival series isn't without its charms, in a more contemporary narrative that brings back Warwick Davis while focusing on the next generation.

item.title: 'Love Actually' director feels 'a bit stupid' about movie's lack of diversity
item.description: Every year, as the days grow colder and Christmas draws nearer, "Love Actually" quickly becomes a festive favorite on people's television screens.

item.title: Joe Pesci says playing Harry in the 'Home Alone' films came with some 'serious' pain
item.description: They say artists have to be willing to do anything for their art, and for Joe Pesci, that includes setting his head on fire.

item.title: Inside Christine McVie's and Stevie Nicks' decades-long friendship
item.description: Throughout the various personal turmoils for which the members of Fleetwood Mac are known, one relationship buoyed the band for decades: the friendship between its two frontwomen, Christine McVie and Stevie Nicks.

item.title: Will Smith, opening up about Oscars slap, tells Trevor Noah 'hurt people hurt people'
item.description: Will Smith opened up to Trevor Noah about the now-famous slap at the Oscars in March during an appearance that aired Monday night on "The Daily Show."

item.title: 'Super Mario Bros. Movie' trailer shows being a hero isn't all fun and games
item.description: Mario learns that being a hero is a tough gig in the new trailer for "Super Mario Bros. Movie."

item.title: 'The Phantom of the Opera' extends Broadway run for eight weeks due to high demand
item.description: The music of the night will continue for eight weeks longer than expected.

item.title: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West reach divorce settlement
item.description: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West have come to a divorce agreement, a source with knowledge of the negotiations tells CNN.

item.title: Marsai Martin and Omari Harwick play to win in 'Fantasy Football'
item.description: The new film "Fantasy Football" capitalizes on some of its stars natural talent.

item.title: In 'Wednesday,' Jenna Ortega makes Netflix's Addams Family series look like a snap
item.description: Although the main character's name was inspired by the poetic line "Wednesday's child is full of woe," "Wednesday" is generally a delight, thanks almost entirely to Jenna Ortega. Having outgrown her Disney Channel days, Ortega makes the Addams Family's now-high-school-age daughter the coolest humorless goth sociopath you'll ever meet, in a Netflix series that's more kooky than spooky or ooky.

item.title: 'Glass Onion' sharpens the 'Knives Out' formula in a polished Netflix sequel
item.description: Rising to the challenge of matching its successful predecessor, "Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery" maintains the razor-sharp formula, with a setup that feels even more conspicuously like an Agatha Christie homage before an extremely clever series of twists kick in. Writer-director Rian Johnson again assembles a solid cast behind Daniel Craig, but it's his use of language -- where nary a word is wasted -- that finally gives the sequel its edge.

item.title: 'Love Actually' cast to reunite for 20th anniversary TV special
item.description: One of the most beloved modern Christmas classics is turning 20 next year, and to mark the occasion, cast members from the landmark 2003 romantic comedy "Love Actually" are reuniting for a TV special to air on ABC next week, the network announced Tuesday.

item.title: James Cameron almost didn't choose Leonardo DiCaprio or Kate Winslet to star in 'Titanic'
item.description: James Cameron is sharing some surprising details from the making of his blockbuster hit "Titanic," which celebrates 25 years of being released next month.
